content.raw: But the `newRoot` here is always added as a root link, implying it must not have any parent joints, and the fact that it doesn't have any parent joints should be identified correctly by the for-loop. It seems to me like it would be incorrect to add a non-root link as a root link, unless there's some post-processing that I haven't gotten to where it will later be connected correctly?
